lines.text:
[Seeing Joe drinking whisky]
Excuse me, monsieur, but I'm opposed to that.

[Belligerently]
Opposed to what?
Taking liquor along.
Well, I'm not. We'll compromise. You live your way. I'll live mine!
For medicinal purposes perhaps it may be useful.

[Smiling]
Best desert remedy on the market!
Poor Paul. He was so kind! How could it happen?

[Cynically]
It happens...
But to him? He believed in God!

I can't recite any Psalms for ya', but I know about people who believe in God. Our friend didn't! He put his faith in his father. A man! A human being! That's an easy faith to lose. I know about that, too.
But he was a good man. He tried to do good. He dreamed of goodness all his life.

I'm gettin' a little sick of this "Poor Paul," "Kind man," "Full of grace." What does it take to wake you up? He didn't believe in anything but being a big-shot with God as a front. I've seen these do-gooders before - usually doin' the most good for themSELVES! Believing in God is different than drooling over rubies and emeralds.
I can cook, I can breathe, I can live!

[Referring to his watch]
Why did you steal it?
I wanted it.

[referring to the lost city]
I've been walkin' around thinkin'. It's a great town for thinkin' - no distractions.
One gets to imagine strange things in the desert.
Yeah, one meets them too!
You never kissed me like thatt before.
I always meant to.
What are we doin', out here in th' middle 'o' nowhere, lookin' fer nothin' in the wrong season!

[Referring to taking Dita on the expedition]
I like my chippies in a room!

[Looking down a underground cavern]
It's pretty foul down there - 2000 years of busy bats!

[Giving Dita a whisky bottle]
Here, dump that out and fill it with water. Shows you how serious the situation is.
Walking alone in the desert is wonderful. It's like walking on the face of a clock that's stopped.

[In reference to his father, whose true character has been revealed]
He lied!
Come on, he's paid his bills.
An adulterer! A murderer!
It can happen to any man, Paul - good *or* bad. Woman throws a harpoon into ya', and ya' go where SHE pulls.

[to Dita]
I made you virtuous... I'll buy your virtue.
